RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 20000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE AUGUST 17, 2022 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POSITIVE FORCE sprinted to a clear lead and set all the pace, fended off the late challenge in deep stretch and just lasted. QUEEN ROSEMARY settled off the pace through the turn, made a late gain and just missed. MS. MALEVOLENCE raced near the back on the inside through the turn then made a late run and was best of the rest. BILLIEANNE hopped leaving the gate then stalked the pace down the backstretch, made a mild bid on the turn but faltered. KATY THE CAT had no speed and was not a threat. SHATTER ME saved ground to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: Positive Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, set pace, just lasted,

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Malevolence
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, inside, late run, best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Shatter Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Katy the Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Billieanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, stalked pace, mild bid, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Queen Rosemary
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, late gain, just missed,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 81. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 20000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE AUGUST 17, 2022 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile O r Over Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CUENCA was roused to the front going into the first turn then set the pace from an unchallenged lead to prove best. OUR FANTASY bumped with outside rival leaving the gate and was pinched back shortly after the break, was allowed to settle midway down the backstretch then moved out to three wide at the half mile marked to make up ground, kept on through the turn and down the stretch but was not enough but proved second best. WILL TAKE ROSES vied for the lead around the first turn from the inside then tracked the leader down the backstretch, made a mild bid on the final turn but tired in the stretch. MONIQUES DAREDEVIL was unhurried through the final turn and passed tiring rival. TERPEYE rushed up from three wide to prompt the pace to the half mile marked then started to fade and finished evenly. BLIND SIGHT was forwardly placed around the first turn the fell back to mid pack down the backstretch and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Blind Sight
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, fell back, middle of pack, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Our Fantasy
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, pinched back, allowed to settle, 3w1/2, not enuf

ENTRY.NAME: Moniques Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Will Take Roses
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, tracked inside, bid 2nd turn, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cuenca
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, set pace, best

ENTRY.NAME: Terpeye
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, prompt pace, faded, finished evenly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 5F Turf CR: 95. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 28900. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. ( If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHOSHANAH sprinted away while under pressure to the half mile marker then edged away to a clear lead around the turn, drifted out in the stretch but held on. LUCCI pressed the pace from the two path to the turn then fell back slightly, made a late surge in the stretch and missed. LIVE FIRE was forwardly placed while racing four wide through the turn then moved out to mid track in the stretch for a late rally but was too late. PAPAL LAW raced in the middle of the pack from off the rail through the turn then made a late rally to improve his position. COMEDY TOWN was off the pace in the two path on the turn, tried to cut the corner into the stretch but lacked room and angled back out to the two path and finished evenly. MT SURIBACHI raced at the back while going two wide around the turn, tipped out to four wide in the stretch and passed tiring rival. S. MUFFIN rushed up to be off the pace while saving ground around the turn but was empty in the stretch. MOBEER raced in the middle of the pack while saving ground around the turn but was not a factor. A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF LIVE FIRE CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF SHOSHANAH FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE IN THE STRETCH, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: S. Muffin
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, off pace, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Comedy Town
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, lacked room, finished evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Mt Suribachi
ENTRY.COMMENT: back, 2wturn, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Shoshanah
ENTRY.OWNER: Hallman Suanne and Horlacher Kyle M
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprint away, edged away, drift out, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Mobeer
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, saved ground turn, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Lucci
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, fell back turn, late surged, missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Live Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, 4wturn, mid track rally, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Papal Law
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, off rail, late rally, improved position

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 17. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TURNPIKE BOB went to the front to a clear lead through the turn then was challenged by outside rival but dug back in, pulled away to prevail. LONGTAIL raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a two wide bid around the turn to engage the leader in upper stretch but was no match for the winner. MYSTIC POINT raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a two wide bid on the turn, tipping out to three wide in upper stretch and gave late effort to be along for the show. WILD CARAMELO stumbled at the start then rushed up to be off the pace to the half mile marker and flattened out. TRUE GOLD stalked the pace from four wide down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker but failed to sustain the bid. CALCULATED THINKIN raced near the back from four wide then made a mid track run in the stretch to improve position. LAST MINUTE MARIO pressed the pace for the first quarter and retreated. OBROTHER ITSYLVIA was always back. CATCH MY VIBE raced in the middle of the pack from three wide to the half mile marker and dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Obrother Itsylvia
ENTRY.COMMENT: always back

ENTRY.NAME: Calculated Thinkin
ENTRY.OWNER: Turn it Up a Notch Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back 4w, mid track stretch, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Last Minute Mario
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Mystic Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 2wturn, 3wupper, late effort, along show

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Caramelo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled start, rush up, off pace, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Longtail
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 2wturn, engaged upper, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Catch My Vibe
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 3w, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Turnpike Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, challenged 1/8, dug in, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: True Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3w3/8, failed to sustain bid,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MIDNIGHT STRIKES stalked the pace down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker but lacked room and fell back, made a rebid from three wide at the top of the stretch and cruised home. EL POLICIA tracked the leader from the inside down the backstretch, moved between horses at the five sixteenths pole and ran into traffic at the top of the stretch, angled out to four wide at the eighth pole and made a late run to be up for the place. WICKED IRISHMAN raced near the back down the backstretch then made a charge at the leader entering the final turn and took over at the three furlong marker, was engaged at the top of the stretch, fought gamely in early stretch but was caught late. SOUTHERN RUNNER was off the pace around the first turn and down the backstretch then moved up from two wide to take a brief lead at the three furlong marker then vied for the lead from the inside to mid stretch and tired. COMBATING trailed the field through the final turn and passed tring rival. WHISKIED UP hustled to the lead into the first turn then edged away in mid turn to take a clear lead but was eclipsed at the three furlong marker and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Combating
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rival

ENTRY.NAME: Whiskied Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead, edged away, eclipsed 3/8, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Southern Runner
ENTRY.OWNER: Martin Frank Brittingham Robert and Bisso Jr Louis A
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, brief lead 3/8, vied inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: El Policia
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, between 5/16, 4w1/8, late run, up 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Strikes
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3w3/8, lacked room, rebid upper, cruised

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Irishman
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, took over 3/8, caught late, gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 17 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Si nce June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROSES FROM HEAVEN co-led from the inside to the three furlong marker then dropped back slightly around the turn, ran down the leader in the stretch and cleared late. SOUPSTER co-led from the two path to the three furlong marker then edged away into the stretch but was collared in the final yards. HELLO GRACIE was off the pace while trailing to mid turn then moved up to go between horses at the quarter pole but was no match for the top two. FIELD LETTERS stalked the pace from three wide then made a mild bid on the turn but lacked the late response in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Roses From Heaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led, ran down leader, cleared late

ENTRY.NAME: Hello Gracie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, between 1/4, no match top two

ENTRY.NAME: Soupster
ENTRY.OWNER: LBR Racing Stable and Panda Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: co-led, edged away, collared late

ENTRY.NAME: Field Letters
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3w, mild bid, lacked late response,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 66. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,0 00.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRUE QUEEN pressed the pace from the three path then took the lead from the half mile marker and pulled away on the turn and held off the late closer. BINOCHE broke out at the start then rushed up to be in striking distance while racing five wide to the turn then tipped in to three wide at the three furlong marker and tipping in to two wide at upper stretch, made a late charge in the stretch to miss the win. PAYNT BY NUMBER was off the pace on the inside to the turn then moved out to two wide around the turn and tipped out to three wide in the stretch, held on for the show. SURCHARGE trailed the field while saving ground around the turn and kept on moving up the inside to improve position. PRAIRIE TALES had good early speed to the half mile marker then retreated. BOUND BY TRUTH was restless in the gate, vied for the lead from two wide then had traffic at the half mile marker and fell back on the turn, failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Paynt by Number
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside, 2wturn, 3wupper, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Prairie Tales
ENTRY.OWNER: Conklin Daniel J and Conklin Marie
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Bound by Truth
ENTRY.OWNER: Stites Christine S and Stites Tracy
ENTRY.COMMENT: restless gate, vied 2w, traffic 1/2, fell back, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Surcharge
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, saved ground turn, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: True Queen
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, led 1/2, pulled away, lasted

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Highclere Inc., Rocky Top Racing LLC & Springtown Show Sta

ENTRY.NAME: Binoche
ENTRY.COMMENT: striking distance, 5w1/2, 3w3/8, late charge, missed
